channel.title: Need help with my server
channel.description:
annyone can help me.....
my server name is runescap3.no-ip.biz when i run my server.....and i put server ip runescap3.no-ip.biz it say error connecting server i runserver aready only i can use 0.0.0.0 plz some1 help me reply back

item.title: Need help with my server
item.dc:creator: @pimpownage pimpownage
item.description:
@pimpownage wrote:

try portforwarding go to run>cmd then type ipconfig, get your default gateway type this in your web browser and make a “virtual server” port as all 43594. you also need to make enviromental variables and system variables which you can do through my computer>system information?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my server
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

You have to open any ports that are being blocked when users are trying to connect to your computer to play on your server. (Usually 43594).

http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my server
item.dc:creator: @GDXChris GDXChris
item.description:
@GDXChris wrote:

Well, On my old computer I had a cheap and VERY crappy firewall. I would open the TCP port 43594 (the basic port for runescpae servers) and my firewall was so stupid it wouldn’t let people connect cause I forgot to unblock the UPD Port 43594 (Which has absolutely nothing to do with a RS server) and it got ‘confused’ and blocked both for safety.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 31, 2007, 05:33:11 PM[/size][hr]If you want step by step help, i need you to tell my, are you running on a wireless router or cable?

Read full topic

answer 2:cant understand[br][size=1]Posted on: October 31, 2007, 05:29:09 PM[/size][hr]so now wat i need to do step by step

item.title: Need help with my server
item.dc:creator: @GDXChris GDXChris
item.description:
@GDXChris wrote:

Well, I can think of two things that helped me when this happened

Answer 1: Do you have the most updated No-IP Client? If so, did you check the box and make sure it was all running properly?

Answer 2: Make sure the firewall isn’t mistaking ports. That happened to me once. I had all ports opened but the firewall blcoked it because I didn’t un-block TCP and UDP

EDIT: And yes, I know that UDP is not required for opening. It’s just a suggestion for other computers with crappy firewalls, like my old computer.

Read full topic
